name: Whole Wheat Chocolate-Coffee Cake
author: Kim
summary: This coffee cake is moist, chocolaty, lightly sweet, and has subtle hints of spice and coffee flavor. It's also made with slightly better-for-you ingredients--which is a bonus!
ingredients: ½ cup brewed black coffee, at room temperature
1 tablespoon powdered sugar, or to taste  (Optional)
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Whisk whole wheat flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, cardamom, and salt together in a medium bowl
Whisk brewed coffee and espresso powder together in a large bowl
Add Greek yogurt, applesauce, maple syrup, eggs, and vanilla extract; whish until thoroughly combined and no lumps remain
Stir in 1/2 of the dry ingredients and mix until just combined
Fold in chocolate chips and walnuts
Pour batter into the prepared pan and place the pan onto a baking sheet
Place both pans in the preheated oven and bake until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out with a few moist crumbs, 50 to 60 minutes
Cool on a wire rack for 30 minutes
Gently run a table knife around the edges of the pan to loosen
Remove the sides of the pan and allow cake to cool completely, 15 to 30 minutes more
Dust with powdered sugar before serving
